This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ACTIV-VOL-CIT.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-06T09:29:29Z Jonathan Davies 2015-03-05T09:59:30+00:00 2015-03-05T09:59:30+00:00 Extended Deadline - Full PhD Bursary to Study Austerity Governance and Urban Crises https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;78bf9abf.1503 Dear Colleagues (with apologies for cross-posting)<br><br>I am reposting this message because the deadline for applications has been extended to Monday 30th March, from Thursday 4th March. We anticipate that interviews will now be held towards the end of April.<br><br>The Department of Politics and Public Policy at De Montfort University is delighted to announce a full PhD studentship, which will be offered to an outstanding student investigating urban crisis, austerity governance and resistance. The scholarship is available for three years full-time study starting October 2015 and provides a bursary of \ufffd\ufffd14,057 pa in addition to covering University tuition fees. [...] Ryan, Holly 2015-03-03T16:37:55+00:00 2015-03-03T16:37:55+00:00 Occupy and Digital Media event 5 March https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;5dbbe14b.1503 The Social Movements and Civil Society Research Group, City University London invites you to its second event this term:<br><br>"Creating the Collective: Digital Media and the Occupy Movement"<br><br>Speaker: Dr Anastasia Kavada (University of Westminster)<br><br>Dr Anastasia Kavada is Senior Lecturer at the Department of Journalism & Mass Communication at the University of Westminster. Her research focuses on the links between online tools and decentralized organizing practices, democratic decision-making, and the development of solidarity among participants in collective action. Anastasia's case studies include, among others, the Global Justice Movement, Avaaz, and the Occupy movement. [...] Stack, Dr Trevor R. 2015-03-02T11:12:08+00:00 2015-03-02T11:12:08+00:00 PhD studentships in Citizenship, Civil Society and Rule of Law at the University of Aberdeen https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;3d5a3732.1503 PhD STUDENTSHIPS IN CITIZENSHIP, CIVIL SOCIETY AND RULE OF LAW AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ABERDEEN<br><br>Deadline: 13 April 2015<br><br>The Centre for Citizenship, Civil Society and Rule of Law (CISRUL) will offer one or more inter-disciplinary 3-year PhD studentships to start in September 2015. The studentships will include fees and partial maintenance. We welcome applicants from anthropology, business, cultural and literary studies, history, legal theory and socio-legal studies, philosophy, politics, religious studies, sociology and theology. [...] Matt Baillie Smith 2015-02-27T13:16:01+00:00 2015-02-27T13:16:01+00:00 PhD Studentship https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;4e6f2deb.1503 Hi all<br><br>The following PhD studentship might be of interest to subscribers:<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Matt<br><br>Funded PhD Studentship: Global citizenship and informal international education<br>Supervisor: Professor Matt Baillie Smith,<br>Department of Social Sciences and Languages, Northumbria University, UK.<br><br>This collaborative PhD studentship with the global civil society organisation CISV International (www.cisv.org<http://www.cisv.org>) will explore the production of 'active global citizenship' through non-formal international peace education programmes. In particular, it will explore what happens to ideas and practices of global citizenship when children, youth and adults from diverse global settings come together in CISV programmes to explore issues such as human rights, [...] Aleksandra Kazlowska (School of Social Policy) 2015-02-23T12:50:12+00:00 2015-02-23T12:50:12+00:00 Call for papers: Rethinking integration conference: 2nd July https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;a6ce3d54.1502 Please find enclosed an invitation for the conference "Rethinking integration: New perspectives on adaptation and settlement in an era of superdiversity"<br>on Thursday 2nd July 2015 organised by the Institute for Research into Superdiversity, University of Birmingham.<br><br>Rethinking integration: New perspectives on adaptation and settlement in an era of superdiversity<br>Thursday 2nd July 2015 (09:00-18:30) [...] Ryan, Holly 2015-01-28T11:00:58+00:00 2015-01-28T11:00:58+00:00 Civil Society Event -City University London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;bfa5a5c7.1501 Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;bfa5a5c7.1501">Civil Society Event -City University London </a> ESA RN 37 Midterm Conference 2014 2014-06-23T16:26:25+01:00 2014-06-23T16:26:25+01:00 European Sociological Association - Research Network 37 Urban Studies - Lisbon Conference in November 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;e62209e0.1406 Dear Sir/ Madam.<br><br>I would like to kindly request you to forward this \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCall for Papers\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>among your contact list. Is regarded the First Conference of the<br>Research Network 37 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdUrban Studies\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd from the European Sociological<br>Association, that will be held in Lisbon Portugal in November 2014.<br><br>Practical information<br><br>Proposal submission deadline: 15 July 2014<br>Acceptance of papers: 15 September 2014 [...] Frances Sleap 2014-05-14T10:55:19+01:00 2014-05-14T10:55:19+01:00 Reminder - Call for papers: Journal of Dialogue Studies 2:2 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;802602a1.1405 Call for Papers<br><br>Journal of Dialogue Studies<br><br>Volume 2, Number 2, Autumn 2014<br><br>'Dialogue Ethics'<br><br>Paper submission deadline: 11th July 2014<br><br>This is a call for papers for the Journal of Dialogue Studies, a<br>multidisciplinary, peer-reviewed academic journal published twice a year.<br>The Journal seeks to bring together a body of original scholarship on the<br>theory and practice of dialogue that can be critically appraised and<br>discussed. It aims to contribute towards establishing 'dialogue studies' as<br>a distinct academic field (or perhaps even emerging discipline). It is hoped<br>that this will be directly useful not only to scholars and students [...] Dave Harte 2014-05-09T11:21:27+01:00 2014-05-09T11:21:27+01:00 Creative Citizens: The Conference. 18 & 19 September 2014 Royal College of Art, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACTIV-VOL-CIT;5eedc75b.1405 Creative Citizens: The Conference<br><br>18 & 19 September 2014\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Royal College of Art, London<br><br>Who are today\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Creative Citizens? What do they do? How are they changing communities? Come and debate new research at the first ever Creative Citizens Conference.<br><br>Register for this exciting programme online now<br><br>The conference will spotlight the motivations, achievements and the potential of creative citizens. Presenters will argue for the importance of creative citizens\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd contribution to civic life to social capital and to the economy. Panels will look at peer to peer creative activism, creative local networking around environmental issues, hyperlocal publishing, migrant and youth [...]
